abstract: Trial of Silk Road founder Ross W Ulbricht has given rise to debate over how jurors should interpret visual chat symbols known as emoji; defense objected to prosecution's omission of one such symbol, a smiley face, while presenting evidence, leading Judge Katherine B Forrest to instruct the jury to take note of them; issue highlights difficulties presented by digital evidence in a growing number of cases.
lead_paragraph: How chats and other messages and their symbols should be presented in court has become a subplot in the trial of a California man charged with running the online black market.
snippet: How chats and other messages and their symbols should be presented in court has become a subplot in the trial of a California man charged with running the online black market.

headline.main: At Silk Road Trial, Lawyers Fight to Include Evidence They Call Vital: Emoji
headline.print_headline: At Trial, Lawyers Fight to Include Evidence They Call Vital: Emoji
